kickstart.post:
PBS_DAEMON=/opt/torque/sbin/trqauthd PBS_HOME=/var/spool/torque
chkconfig --add trqauthd chkconfig trqauthd on
&Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain;
MANPATH /opt/torque/man
# Changes for big clusters
* - memlock -1 * - stack -1 * - nofile 4096
# these are also needed in the pbs startup scripts. # just hack them into the beginning sed -i -e 20i"ulimit -l unlimited" /etc/init.d/pbs_mom sed -i -e 20i"ulimit -s unlimited" /etc/init.d/pbs_mom sed -i -e 20i"ulimit -n 4096" /etc/init.d/pbs_mom
fs.file-max = 65536 #recommended values for large cluster from clusterresources.com # Don't allow the arp table to become bigger than this net.ipv4.neigh.default.gc_thresh3 = 4096 # Tell the gc when to become aggressive with arp table cleaning. # Adjust this based on size of the LAN. net.ipv4.neigh.default.gc_thresh2 = 2048 # Adjust where the gc will leave arp table alone net.ipv4.neigh.default.gc_thresh1 = 1024 # Adjust to arp table gc to clean-up more often net.ipv4.neigh.default.gc_interval = 3600 # ARP cache entry timeout net.ipv4.neigh.default.gc_stale_time = 3600
export PATH=$PATH:/opt/maui/bin:/opt/torque/bin:/opt/torque/sbin
export MANPATH=/opt/torque/man:$MANPATH
set path = ( $path /opt/maui/bin /opt/torque/bin /opt/torque/sbin )
if ( $?MANPATH ) then setenv MANPATH /opt/torque/man:"$MANPATH" else setenv MANPATH /opt/torque/man endif
